docs.lead_paragraph: I was drinking coffee in the kitchen one night a few years ago when I heard, emanating from our stereo system two rooms away, the unmistakable voice of Marilyn Monroe singing ''Happy Birthday, Mr. President.'' Startled, I asked my wife, Gina, what that recording was doing on our stereo.

headline.main: Marilyn and Me: Dealing With Illusions (or Life on a Parkinson's Drug)

docs.abstract: Mark Derr Cases column describes auditory illusions he experienced while on Parkinson's drug; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: Virtually all the drugs used to increase dopamine levels in people with Parkinson's can apparently bring on hallucinations.
